Hey guys!
I was wondering why I can't insert the file url by {{contact.file}} in my template for marketing email as I can do when I create a simple email from scratch.
I've trying to figure out what's going on for about three days, but I don't know why it doesn't work :confused:
Could you please help me? Thank you a lot!
You can if it is a text field that has the file url in it ...

I've tried it but I want a customized url for each contact, and I want to get that by {{contact.file}}.
Each contact has one url file in their file property and I want they can be redirected onto this link clicking on something at this email.
I can get that when I write {{contact.file}} on email, but the recipient receive the long url, which I don't think it's nice, so I'd like to hide it behind some word/image etc
You would have to inset that into an anchor tag with text

I just tried it but it seems is showing the whole tag to the recipient.
When I put {{contact.file}} in the href field, I receive an error message (as you can see at the first image attached here), then I tried to put a token using the same property in the same field, but it doesn't work anyway :confused: (you can see it at the second and third images attached here)
